how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Other
as you selected other: what are other pr: Reference (my "household wiki" e.g info about which, say, vacuum cleaner bags my vc requires)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: For work, it is an essential tool where I collect and structure all ideas around the work and its projects, and meeting notes. It allows the ideas to accumulate and link over time, and for me to reference them.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: TiddlySpot / TiddlyHost;No automatic sync across my devices

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Many UI tweaks have been made into the plugins above (notably the Boosters plugin) but of particular importance: The close and delete buttons navigate to previous tiddler. The tiddler editview UI is much simplified. Titles as links.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: The helpfulness in the community is amazing, including Jeremys presence there.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I won't leave but am afraid Jeremy disappears one day and things deteriorate. 
"confident TW meet future needs" - No, b/c lacking prio of (1) multiuser solution (2) multiwiki communication (3) integration (4) saving issues will continue (5) continued misleading by describing TW as a note-taking system when it is more a note *management* system. *Taking* notes is clunky in TW compared to actual note taking systems.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
